- Each frame of snooker generally consists of two phases. The first phase lasts as long as any red balls remain on the table.

Advanced information:
- The red ball is placed on the "baulk" at the beginning of the game, and the first player begins by playing in-hand from behind the baulk line.
- American snooker often uses 54mm balls, but may use standard 52.5mm balls. It is typically played on a table, as full-size regulation British-style tables are rare in the United States.
- A snooker table has six pockets, one at each corner and one at the center of each of the longest side cushions. The pockets are around 86mm, though high-class tournaments may use slightly smaller pockets to increase difficulty.
